page.title: 02FAMILY LIFE IN THE 1980s
page.content: Families lead increasingly busy lives in 1985 and the increase in working mothers has meant a fundamental change in the activities of some families. There is evidence that two- and three-child families are most popular. There is also a growing proportion of split-parent families. Children are involved in various hobbies and activities in the evenings; Girl Guides, Scouts, Cubs and Brownies are always popular. Badminton, Judo, Karate, Football, Cricket, Dancing, Gymnastics, Swimming and Lifesaving Take place at Baths and Sports Centres in Crewe and Nantwich. The main form of entertainment in the house is television; computer activities and listening to music are also popular. The reading of books, and playing of card and board games are less popular.
